metadata.feature_description: Provides multi-language support for search crawler administration.

steps.action: Navigated to Site Settings > Search page
steps.expected: Search Crawler settings UI should display with properly localized text labels
steps.actual: Search settings page displayed with localized English UI text including tabs (Basic Settings, Synonyms, Ignore Words, Crawling, File Extensions) and field labels (Minimum Word Length, Maximum Word Length, etc.)

steps.action: Clicked on Crawling tab to view crawler-specific settings
steps.expected: Crawling settings should display with localized section headers and column labels
steps.actual: Crawling tab displayed with properly localized text: URL PATHS, DUPLICATES, Included Directories, Excluded Directories sections with appropriate column headers (URL, Enable Spidering, DNN Impersonation, Windows Auth, Description, Regex Pattern, Directory)

steps.expected: File Extensions settings should display with localized labels
steps.actual: File Extensions tab displayed with properly localized text: INCLUDED FILE EXTENSIONS, EXCLUDED FILE EXTENSIONS sections with column headers (File Extension, File Type, Content Crawling) and action buttons (Add File Type)

steps.action: Selected Spanish language from the language selector in the PersonaBar
steps.expected: UI should either display Spanish translations or fall back to default English if translations are not available
steps.actual: UI correctly fell back to default English language when Spanish was selected, as no Spanish resource files are installed for the Search Crawler module. This is expected behavior - the LocalizationHelper.cs uses DNN's Localization.GetString() which falls back to the default resource file when translations are unavailable.

observations: The LocalizationHelper.cs class uses DNN's standard Localization.GetString() method pointing to DesktopModules/DNNCorp/SearchCrawler/App_LocalResources/CrawlerSettings.ascx.resx
SharedResources.resx contains approximately 35 localized strings for error messages, log messages, tooltips, and UI labels used throughout the Search Crawler module
The resource files include strings for file crawler results, indexing status messages, directory paths, and error notifications
Only English (default) resource files are present - no language-specific resource files (e.g., SharedResources.es-ES.resx) were found in the codebase, which explains the fallback behavior
The language selector in the PersonaBar controls content language context, not necessarily the admin UI language - this is standard DNN behavior
